title: 10 Best Netflix Movies Of 2024
body_text:
Summary
- The best Netflix movies showcase a diverse range of genres, from heartwarming family films to thrilling sci-fi adventures.
- Netflix continues to deliver high-quality productions in 2024 with gems like Code 8: Part II and My Name Is Loh Kiwan.
- Standout performances, engaging plots, and superior visual effects elevate Netflix movies like Good Grief and The Beautiful Game.
The best Netflix movies reflect the ability of the streaming giant to deliver exceptional content consistently, a key reason why it remains a dominant force in the streaming industry. The platform offers an extensive range of titles, blending original productions with licensed blockbuster films. Spanning multiple decades and virtually every genre, Netflix boasts an impressive catalog of movies, from heartwarming family films to thought-provoking sci-fi adventures to sidesplitting comedies. The best Netflix movies of 2023 included gems like Nyad, The Killer, Maestro, and May December, further solidifying its reputation for high-quality productions.
Netflix released a slate of notable films in 2024 that have captured the hearts and minds of audiences worldwide. Some of these Netflix movies premiered at prestigious film festivals or were released in limited theaters last year, but they all officially debuted on the streamer in 2024, making them eligible for this list. From critically acclaimed dramas to innovative animations and thrilling genre pieces, these Netflix original movies exemplify the platform's commitment to delivering top-notch entertainment. Here are the best Netflix movies of 2024 that showcase the streaming service's ability to provide fresh and engaging content for its subscribers.
Best Horror Movies On Netflix
With all the streaming content out there, you're bound to find a great horror film to enjoy for the season and Netflix is the best place to look at.
10 Code 8: Part II
A Superb Sci-Fi Sequel That Balances High-Octane Action With Intimate Character Moments
Directed by Jeff Chan, the Code 8: Part II cast sees the return of the talented cousin duo, Stephen and Robbie Amell, reprising their roles as Garrett Kelton and Connor Reed. The sci-fi sequel continues the story from the original Code 8, where Connor, played by Robbie Amell, is released from prison and attempts to start afresh. However, his plans are disrupted when he encounters Pav, a teenager on the run from corrupt police officers. The Code 8: Part II script perfectly balances high-octane action and intimate character moments. This blending of action and emotion allows the actors to shine.
With its dynamic performances, engaging plot, and superior visual effects, Code 8: Part II elevates the franchise and secures its place as one of the best Netflix movies of 2024.
The performances of the Amell cousins are standout, with Robbie delivering a particularly emotional portrayal of a man trying to do right despite his past, and Stephen excelling as the morally complex Garrett. Code 8: Part II also introduces new powers and enhanced sci-fi elements, like the impressive robotic K9s replacing the Guardians, adding excitement to the action sequences. With its dynamic performances, engaging plot, and superior visual effects, Code 8: Part II elevates the franchise and secures its place as one of the best Netflix movies of 2024.
9 My Name Is Loh Kiwan
One Of The Best K-Dramas On Netflix
My Name is Loh Kiwan blends elements of romance and drama to offer a realistic portrayal of an immigrant experience. Debut-directed by Kim Hee-jin, My Name is Loh Kiwan is not based on a true story but on a 2011 novel by Cho Haejin. The movie follows the harrowing journey of the titular Loh Kiwan, a North Korean defector who flees his homeland with his mother. Initially finding refuge in China, Loh's struggles as an immigrant begin and continue as he moves to Belgium, where he awaits his official refugee status.
No doubt one of the best Korean dramas on Netflix, My Name is Loh Kiwan is a testament to the power of storytelling and the resilience of the human spirit.
The film's narrative takes a significant turn when Loh Kiwan meets Lee Marie, a former athlete dealing with her own personal tragedies, leading to an unexpected bond that evolves into a touching romance. Their chemistry is palpable, and their individual struggles create a rich, layered narrative. Despite its often tragic storyline, My Name is Loh Kiwan's ending is lighter and more hopeful, balancing the film's emotional weight. No doubt one of the best Korean dramas on Netflix, My Name is Loh Kiwan is a testament to the power of storytelling and the resilience of the human spirit.
8 Good Grief
A Poignant Exploration Of Loss And Healing
Good Grief marks the directorial debut of Dan Levy, known for his iconic role as David Rose in Schitt's Creek, the multiple Emmy-winning sitcom. Levy transitions to a more somber and introspective narrative, himself starring as Marc, a grieving widower navigating the aftermath of his husband's tragic death. Good Grief chronicles Marc's journey as he travels to Paris with his close friends, Thomas and Sophie – it unfolds with Marc discovering painful secrets about his late husband, Oliver. Levy's multifaceted involvement as creator, director, producer, and lead actor imbues Good Grief with a deeply personal touch.
The film expertly balances sardonic humor and poignant drama, making it a compelling exploration of loss and healing
The film expertly balances sardonic humor and poignant drama, making it a compelling exploration of loss and healing. Good Grief's cast is stellar across the board, with Levy capturing the tumultuous path of grief with authenticity and supporting actors Himesh Patel and Ruth Negga portraying the intricacies of friendship and the unspoken challenges of adulthood. The romantic backdrop of Paris and the raw, often ironic humor make Good Grief a unique blend of heartache and hope.
The 30 Most-Watched Netflix Movies Of All Time
Between action-packed adventures, dramas, and comedies — all of which star A-list actors —, here are Netflix's most-watched movies of all time.
7 Scoop
A Gripping Journalism Drama About The Infamous Interview With Prince Andrew
- Release Date
- April 5, 2024
- Runtime
- 102 Minutes
- Director
- Philip Martin
- Writers
- Geoff Bussetil, Peter Moffat
Cast
-
Rufus Sewell
- Studio(s)
- The Lighthouse, Voltage TV
- Distributor(s)
- Netflix
- Main Genre
- Biography
Inspired by real events surrounding the infamous BBC Newsnight interview with Prince Andrew, Scoop delves into the world of high-stakes journalism. It was adapted by Peter Moffat from Sam McAlister's memoir and directed by Philip Martin. Scoop's story follows McAlister (Billie Piper) and Emily Maitlis (Gillian Anderson) as they navigate intense negotiations and prepare for a career-defining interview. Set against the backdrop of the Jeffrey Epstein scandal, the film explores the professional and personal challenges these journalists faced in their relentless pursuit of the truth.
Despite some criticisms regarding the mixed motivations of its central characters, Scoop combines the tension of investigative journalism with the drama of a real-life scandal.
Scoop's stellar cast is its biggest strength. Piper's portrayal of the tenacious McAlister captures the complexity of a journalist driven by both professional ambition and a deeper commitment to uncovering the truth. Anderson's depiction of Maitlis highlights the delicate balance of maintaining journalistic integrity while facing formidable subjects. Despite some criticisms regarding the mixed motivations of its central characters, Scoop combines the tension of investigative journalism with the drama of a real-life scandal.
6 The Kitchen
A Visually Arresting Sci-Fi Drama Set In A Futuristic Dystopian London
- Release Date
- January 19, 2024
- Runtime
- 107 Minutes
- Director
- Kibwe Tavares, Daniel Kaluuya
- Writers
- Rob Hayes, Daniel Kaluuya, Joe Murtagh
Cast
-
Kane Robinson
-
Jedaiah Bannerman
- Studio(s)
- 59% Productions, DMC Film, Factory Fifteen, Film4
- Distributor(s)
- Netflix
The Kitchen, co-directed by Daniel Kaluuya and Kibwe Tavares, is a visually arresting sci-fi drama set in a futuristic dystopian London where social housing has been eradicated. The film follows Izi (Kane Robinson), who is determined to escape the last social housing establishment, only to have his plans disrupted by a young boy, Benji (Jedaiah Bannerman). Their relationship forces Izi to reconsider his priorities and fight for the remaining residents. The Kitchen's exploration of societal inequities and rebellion resonates deeply, even if its central drama occasionally feels stagnant.
The Kitchen excels in its world-building and boasts a strong cast that brings a complex, layered story to life.
The Kitchen excels in its world-building and boasts a strong cast that brings a complex, layered story to life. Kane Robinson shines as Izi, portraying a character brimming with suppressed rage and vulnerability. Kaluuya's directorial debut showcases his keen instincts, from the innovative use of deconstructed Nike masks in the opening heist to the unique style of the gang led by Hope Ikpoku Jr.'s character. Despite some narrative imbalances, The Kitchen stands out for its compelling performances and thought-provoking themes.
5 24 Hours With Gaspar
A Gritty, Neo-Noire Thriller About A Detective With Only 24 Hours To Live
24 Hours with Gaspar is a gritty, visually captivating film. Directed by Yosep Anggi Noen, this adaptation of Sabda Armandio's dystopian novel tells the story of Gaspar (Reza Rahadian), a hardboiled detective with only 24 hours to live due to a heart condition. His mission is to tie up loose ends from his past, particularly the mysterious disappearance of his childhood friend Kirana (Shofia Shireen). As Gaspar navigates a decaying urban landscape, he confronts his mortality and the worst of humanity, making for a compelling, albeit dark, narrative.
The film excels with its blend of neo-noir and dystopian aesthetics, enhanced by an engaging score and striking visuals.
The film excels with its blend of neo-noir and dystopian aesthetics, enhanced by an engaging score and striking visuals. Despite some pacing issues and an overuse of flashbacks, Noen's direction ensures the story remains captivating. The supporting cast, including Shenina Cinnamon and Laura Basuki, brings depth to the narrative, while Rahadian's portrayal of Gaspar adds a layer of emotional intensity. With its poignant ending and well-crafted worldbuilding, 24 Hours with Gaspar is a must-watch, showcasing Noen's ability to balance beauty and bleakness skillfully.
4 The Beautiful Game
A Moving Sports Drama About Homeless Football Players
- Release Date
- March 29, 2024
- Runtime
- 125 Minutes
- Director
- Thea Sharrock
- Writers
- Frank Cottrell-Boyce
Cast
-
Bill Nighy
-
Micheal Ward
- Studio(s)
- Film4, Blueprint Pictures
- Distributor(s)
- Netflix
The Beautiful Game captures football's universal language, breaking down national barriers and highlighting the unifying, transformative power of sports.
The Beautiful Game is a moving sports drama inspired by real-life stories of former players. Directed by Thea Sharrock and written by Frank Cottrell Boyce, the film stars Bill Nighy as Mal, a coach guiding a diverse group of homeless football players to the Homeless World Cup. The plot centers on Vinny (Micheal Ward), a struggling father grappling with his situation while striving for redemption on and off the pitch. The movie captures football's universal language, breaking down national barriers and highlighting the unifying, transformative power of sports. Additionally, The Beautiful Game excels in its raw, authentic portrayal of homelessness.
The film introduces various teams, each reflecting different global definitions of homelessness, from the US team with Rosita, an undocumented teenager, to the mature Japanese team highlighting Japan's elderly homeless population. Ward's nuanced performance as Vinny brings dramatic heft, portraying his complex journey from a cold and stand-offish character to one seeking acceptance and redemption. Supported by strong performances from Callum Scott Howells, Kit Young, and Susan Wokoma, The Beautiful Game delivers a relatable human story of shattered dreams and second chances.
26 Best Netflix Movies Based On True Stories
There are thousands of movies to choose from on Netflix, but if you are in the mood for a true story, these are the best of them all.
3 Orion And The Dark
An Uplifting Adventure About A Young Boy Who Confronts His Fear Of The Dark
- Release Date
- February 2, 2024
- Runtime
- 92 Minutes
- Director
- Sean Charmatz
- Writers
- Charlie Kaufman, Lloyd Taylor, Emma Yarlett
Cast
-
Jacob Tremblay
- Studio(s)
- DreamWorks Animation, Mikros Animation
- Distributor(s)
- Netflix
- Where To Stream
- Netflix
Orion and the Dark is an uplifting animated adventure about a young boy, Orion (Jacob Tremblay), who faces his greatest fear: the dark. In the process, he embarks on a one-night odyssey where he encounters personified concepts that challenge his perspectives, ultimately putting the world at risk due to his anxieties. Led by Tremblay and featuring Paul Walter Hauser, Angela Bassett, and Nat Faxon, Orion and the Dark's voice cast is simply stellar and brings life to abstract characters, enhancing the story's emotional depth.
The animation is visually stunning and innovative, reflecting Charmatz's creative flair and dedication to honoring the source material.
The film's unique approach and thematic depth, coupled with Kaufman's influence, make Orion and the Dark stand out in the animated genre. Despite tackling serious themes, it remains accessible to a young audience while resonating with viewers of all ages. The animation is visually stunning and innovative, reflecting Charmatz's creative flair and dedication to honoring the source material. This combination of heartfelt storytelling, exceptional voice acting, and captivating visuals cements Orion and the Dark as one of the best Netflix movies of 2024.
2 Hit Man
An Inventive Action Comedy About A Philosophy Professor Turned Assassin
- Release Date
- May 24, 2024
- Runtime
- 116 minutes
- Director
- Richard Linklater
- Writers
- Richard Linklater, Glen Powell
- Producers

Cast
-
Gary Johnson
-
Madison Figueroa Masters
- Studio(s)
- AGC Studios, Detour Filmproduction, Aggregate Films, BarnStorm Productions
Hit Man is a testament to Richard Linklater's directorial prowess and Glen Powell's comedic timing.
Hit Man is a testament to Richard Linklater's directorial prowess and Glen Powell's comedic timing. Based on a true story from a 2001 Texas Monthly article, the film follows Gary Johnson (Powell), a philosophy professor who unexpectedly excels as an undercover hitman for the New Orleans police. His success in –– and genuine enjoyment of –– this unorthodox role leads him to explore deeper questions about identity and morality, themes that are skillfully woven throughout the narrative. Linklater's Hit Man addresses several modern cinematic issues, including the scarcity of feature-length comedies and the complete lack of sex in mainstream cinema.
Powell's performance, coupled with Adria Arjona's portrayal of Madison, a woman seeking to escape her abusive husband, injects the film with a vibrant chemistry reminiscent of classic on-screen duos. Their relationship adds a thrilling layer of complexity as Gary's alter ego, Ron, and Madison's spontaneous connection evolves. Hit Man deftly balances humor, intrigue, and philosophical exploration, making it a thought-provoking yet highly entertaining watch.
1 Society Of The Snow
A Harrowing Tale Of Survival Against Unimaginable Odds
- Release Date
- December 15, 2023
- Runtime
- 144 Minutes
- Director
- J.A. Bayona
Cast
-
Matías Recalt
-
Agustin Pardella
Society of the Snow is perhaps Netflix's best film of 2024, delivering a harrowing yet compelling tale of survival against unimaginable odds. Directed by J.A. Bayona, Society of the Snow explores the true story of the 1972 Andes plane crash involving a Uruguayan rugby team. The film has been celebrated for its accuracy and respect towards real-life events and is praised by the survivors and their families. The Society of the Snow ensemble cast, composed entirely of Argentine and Uruguayan actors, authentically portrays the passengers' desperate struggle to stay alive.
The film's technical brilliance, coupled with its profound storytelling, ensures that viewers experience both the physical and emotional journey of the survivors.
Bayona's meticulous direction, paired with the hauntingly beautiful cinematography by Pedro Luque, captures the stark reality of the Andes' deadly beauty and the relentless cold that the survivors faced. Society of the Snow examines cannibalism, particularly its legal and ethical ramifications of the survivors' extreme measures to endure 72 days in the icy wilderness. The film's technical brilliance, coupled with its profound storytelling, ensures that viewers experience both the physical and emotional journey of the survivors. Society of the Snow stands as a testament to the human spirit and raises the bar for disaster films.
Society of the Snow has been nominated for two Academy Awards, two Critics' Choice Awards, one Golden Globe Award, and one BAFTA Award.
